intro: Stenanthemum centrale, commonly known as the central stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Stenanthemum centrale is often found in the south-western region of Western Australia.
